Package it.polimi.se2019.view.gui

Class BoardScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.HBox
              • it.polimi.se2019.view.gui.BoardScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    class BoardScreen
extends javafx.scene.layout.HBox
    Represent the main screen visualized during the game and allow communication between the view and the various graphical elements that compose this screen.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BoardScreen

        BoardScreen​(View GUIView)
        Creates a BoardScreen with the elements that the user of the view can visualize. Uses BoardFX to represent the board and PlayerBoardFX to represent the players boards. The elements are placed dynamically and the result is scaled to fit the whole screen.
        Parameters:
        GUIView - the view containing all the information about the player

    • Method Detail

      • updateBoard

        void updateBoard​(ViewBoard viewBoard,
                 java.util.List<ViewPlayer> players)
        Updates all the PlayerBoardFXs and the BoardFX after a total update.
        Parameters:
        viewBoard - the updated board received in the totalUpdate
        players - the players of the match received in the totalupdate

      • updatePlayer

        private boolean updatePlayer​(ViewPlayer p,
                             int i)
        Updates a playerBoardFX after a totalUpdate.
        Parameters:
        p - the player corresponding to the playerBoard
        i - the index of the player in the match's player list
        Returns:
        true if the player is not a spawn and not the user false otherwise

      • setSelectableOptionsWrapper

        void setSelectableOptionsWrapper​(SelectableOptionsWrapper selectableOptionsWrapper)
        Sets the SelectableOptionsWrapper and displays to the player the possible options that can be selected.
        Parameters:
        selectableOptionsWrapper - a SelectableOptionsWrapper containing the current selectable options

      • getWeaponsFromColor

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> getWeaponsFromColor​(java.lang.String color,
                                                             ViewBoard viewBoard)
        Returns a list of the weapons belonging to a spawn point of a specific color.
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the spawn point to get the weapon from
        viewBoard - the board containing the spawn point
        Returns:
        a list of the weapons in the spawnpoint

      • updatePowerUps

        void updatePowerUps​(java.util.List<ViewPowerUp> viewPowerUps)
        Updates the ImageViews of the powerUps in the powerUpsBox after a totalUpdate.
        Parameters:
        viewPowerUps - a list of ViewPowerups that the user owns

      • updateWeapons

        void updateWeapons​(java.util.List<ViewWeapon> weapons)
        Updates the ImageViews of the weapons in the weaponsBox after a totalUpdate
        Parameters:
        weapons - the ViewWeapons that the user currently owns

      • updateMessages

        void updateMessages​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> messages)
        Updates the messages in the messages ListView after receiving a new message
        Parameters:
        messages - the new messages that must be displayed to the player

      • updatePoints

        void updatePoints​(int pts)
        Updates the TextField that displays the points that the user currently have
        Parameters:
        pts - the point that the user currently haves

      • showAmmoChoice

        private void showAmmoChoice​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> ammoChoiceOptions)
        Displays a dialog with the possible ammo that the user cas choose
        Parameters:
        ammoChoiceOptions - a list of the possible ammo that the user can choose

      • formatSelectableOptions

        private java.lang.String formatSelectableOptions()
        Transforms the SelectableOptions into a string that can be displayed to the user through a dialog.
        Returns:
        a String containing all the SelectableOptions informations
